content.text: is designed to create a new account in the
table based on data from the
table. It performs several validation checks before proceeding with the account creation. The procedure also updates the
record to mark it as processed once the account is successfully created. The procedure includes exception handling to manage errors during execution.

The procedure involves multiple validation checks, conditional logic, and database operations, including inserts and updates. It also includes exception handling, which adds to its complexity. However, it does not involve complex calculations or extensive data transformations, keeping it at a medium complexity level.
: The unique identifier for the exchange data record to be processed.
: The ID of the user executing the procedure, used for auditing purposes.
: An output parameter that shows the status of the procedure execution (1 for success, 0 for failure).
: An output parameter that provides a message about the procedure's execution, including error messages if applicable.
: The procedure first checks if the exchange record is marked as excluded. If so, it sets a message and status code, throws an exception, and exits.
: It verifies if the exchange record exists. If not, it sets a message and status code, throws an exception, and exits.
: It checks if the exchange record has already been processed. If it has, it sets a message and status code, throws an exception, and exits.
: It checks if the account number already exists in the system with an active status or as a current account. If so, it sets a message and status code, throws an exception, and exits.
: It determines the service classification by joining
. If no classification is found, it sets a message and status code, throws an exception, and exits.
: It inserts a new record into the
: After insertion, it updates the new account record to set
record to mark it as processed and associates it with the new account.
: If any error occurs during the process, it catches the exception, sets an error message and status code, and throws the exception.
columns are indexed to optimize the
: Although not explicitly mentioned, wrapping the insert and update operations in a transaction ensure atomicity and consistency.
: Consider potential concurrency issues if multiple instances of this procedure are executed simultaneously, especially regarding the
could lead to the procedure terminating abruptly, which might not be ideal for all scenarios.
: The use of hardcoded values like '99991231' and '999912' for dates could lead to issues if these values are not handled correctly in the application logic.
record is accurate and complete. Any missing or incorrect data could lead to incorrect account creation.
: As the volume of data grows, the performance of the procedure might degrade if not optimized, particularly the validation checks and joins.
: Ensure that the procedure is executed with appropriate permissions to prevent unauthorized data access or modifications.

--**************************************************************************************
--* Description:	"47" Create a new account and identify the first associated meter
--*
--* AUTHOR:       MOHAMMED BELARREM
--* Created On:   06/15/2016
--**************************************************************************************
--* Change Log
--* 
--* 06/15/2016 MOH  First Version 
--* 11/29/2016	zd	9999 99 99 and 9999 99 dates to 99991231 and 999912
--* 03/27/2017 zd  Added Throw for exception handling
--* 04/09/2019 VY   Modified for EnergySubTypeID
--***************************************************************************************
CREATE PROCEDURE [Common].[usp_ProcessExchange_Code47]
(
	@ExchangeSeqid AS INT
	,@AuthenticatedUserID AS INT
	,@StatusCode AS INT OUTPUT
	,@Message AS VARCHAR(1000) OUT
)
AS
BEGIN
	DECLARE @RecordExchangeCode VARCHAR(2)

	-- if the record is flagged as exclude, return and exit
	IF ('Y' = (SELECT Exclude FROM Common.ExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid))
	BEGIN
		SET @Message = 'This exchange is excluded from processing. ExchangeSeqid: ' + CAST(@ExchangeSeqid AS VARCHAR(8)) 
		SET @StatusCode = 1	-- this is not necessary an error
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
		RETURN
	END;
	-- do some validation 

	-- CHECK IF the record exists
	IF (NOT EXISTS(SELECT ExchangeDataSeqid FROM Common.ExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid))
	BEGIN
		SET @Message = 'The ExchangeSeqid ' + CAST(@ExchangeSeqid AS VARCHAR(8)) + ' does not exist. Please verify '
		SET @StatusCode = 0
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
		RETURN
	END;

	-- check if the record was processed
	IF ('N' <> (SELECT IsProcessed FROM Common.ExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid))
	BEGIN
		SET @Message = 'This 47 exchange was already processed. ExchangeSeqid: ' + CAST(@ExchangeSeqid AS VARCHAR(8)) 
		SET @StatusCode = 0
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
		RETURN
	END;

	-- check if the current account number is already in the system under an active status
	DECLARE @AccountNumber VARCHAR(15)
	SELECT @AccountNumber = CurrentAccountNumber FROM Common.ExchangeData WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid

	IF (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Billing.Account WHERE OriginalAccountNumber = @AccountNumber AND AccountStatus IN ('AC' , '47', '46', 'UA') AND IsCurrentRecord = 'Y'))
	BEGIN
		SET @Message = 'The account number: ' + @AccountNumber + ' is already in the system under an active status. Please verfiy ' 
		SET @StatusCode = 0
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
		RETURN
	END;

	IF (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Billing.Account WHERE OriginalAccountNumber = @AccountNumber AND IsCurrentRecord = 'Y'))
	BEGIN
		SET @Message = 'The account number: ' + @AccountNumber + ' is already in the system under as current account. If account has the same facility, agency and the address its same account, activate if its inactive and ignore the exchange data, if it doesnt match contact DEM.' 
		SET @StatusCode = 0
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
		RETURN
	END;


	BEGIN TRY	
		-- set some defaults
		DECLARE @UnknownAgencySeqid	AS INT, @UnknownFacilitySeqid AS INT, @AccountStatus AS VARCHAR(2)
			,@PreviousAccountStatus AS VARCHAR(2), @UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid AS INT
			,@ServiceClassification AS VARCHAR(3), @BillingPeriod AS VARCHAR(6);

		SELECT @UnknownAgencySeqid = 396, @UnknownFacilitySeqid	= 4623, @AccountStatus = 'AC', @PreviousAccountStatus = 'AC';
		SELECT @BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod FROM Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame WHERE CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y';

		-- figure out the service classification 
		SELECT @UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid = UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid 
		FROM Billing.UtilityTariffRateInformation INNER JOIN 
				Common.ExchangeData ON ExchangeData.UtilityCompanySeqid = UtilityTariffRateInformation.UtilityCompanyTariff 
				AND ExchangeData.DeliveryServiceClass = UtilityTariffRateInformation.DeliveryTariffRate
				AND ExchangeData.TODAccount = UtilityTariffRateInformation.IsTod
		WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid
	
		IF (@UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid IS NULL or @UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid = 0)
		BEGIN
            SET @Message = 'The service classification reported on account: ' + @AccountNumber + ' is not in the system. Please verify or create first '
			SET @StatusCode = 0
			;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
			RETURN
		END;
				
		-- insert the new account number
		INSERT INTO [Billing].[Account]
			([ExcessDistributionAssocEnergyAccount]
			,[IsExcessDistribution]
			,[CommodityAssocDeliveryAccount]
			,[IsCommodityAccount]
			,[UtilityAccountProvider]
			,[AgencyAccount]
			,[FacilityAccount]
			,UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid
			,[AgencyEnergyBillingBudgetLine]
			,[ManualDataEntry]
			,[CurrentAccountNumber]
			,[OriginalAccountNumber]
			,[ReadingCycleNumber]
			,[AccountStatus]
			,[AccountPreviousStatus]
			,[AccountStatusCodePeriod]
			,[CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup]
			,[AccountEffectiveTurnOn]
			,[AccountEffectiveTurnOff]
			,[EnergySource]
			,[EnergyAccountDescription]
			,[EnergyDeliverySubTypeId] /* added on 4/9/2019 */
			,[IsMultipleEnergySourceAccount]
			,[IsTimeOfDayAccount]
			,[HasAccountLevelChange]
			,[HasMeters]
			,[HasMultipleActiveMeters]
			,[SalesType]
			,[DeliveryTariffRate]
			,[DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate]
			,[CommodityTariffRate]
			,[CommodityTariffEffectiveDate]
			,[BillingCycle]
			,[Delivery]
			,[AccountInMultipleBuildings]
			,[SourceOfRevenue]
			,[TurnOnDate]
			,[TurnOffDate]
			,[MunicipalCode]
			,[Territory]
			,[Tension]
			,[TripNumber]
			,[PartSupplied]
			,[UtilityServiceAccountName]
			,[UtilityServiceAddress]
			,[Borough]
			,[Block]
			,[LotNumber]
			,[CityPlanningBIN]
			,[ELOAgencyAddress]
			,[LastPeriodOriginalBilled]
			,[LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled]
			,[LastZeroDollarsBillingPeriod]
			,[IsSeasonalAccount]
			,[AdjustmentRecordSeqid]
			,[ContractNumber]
			,[FireAuditTrigger]
			,[Notes]
			,[AuthenticatedUserID]
			,[DateAdded]
			,[LastUpdate])
		SELECT 
			NULL --[ExcessDistributionAssocEnergyAccount]
			,'N' --[IsExcessDistribution]
			,null --[CommodityAssocDeliveryAccount]
			,'N' --[IsCommodityAccount]
			,UtilityCompanySeqid	 --[UtilityAccountProvider]
			,ISNULL(AgencySeqid, @UnknownAgencySeqid) --[AgencyAccount]
			,ISNULL(FacilitySeqid, @UnknownFacilitySeqid) --[FacilityAccount]
			,@UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid --[UtilityTariffRateInformationSeqid]
			,NULL --[AgencyEnergyBillingBudgetLine]
			,ManualDataEntry --[ManualDataEntry]
			,CurrentAccountNumber --[CurrentAccountNumber]
			,CurrentAccountNumber --[OriginalAccountNumber]
			,NULL --[ReadingCycleNumber]
			,@AccountStatus --[AccountStatus]
			,@PreviousAccountStatus --[AccountPreviousStatus]
			,@BillingPeriod --[AccountStatusCodePeriod]
			,AccountBillingGroupSeqid --[CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup]
			,AccountEffectiveTurnOn --[AccountEffectiveTurnOn]
			,'99991231' --[AccountEffectiveTurnOff]
			,EnergyDeliveryType --[EnergySource]
			,EnergyDeliveryType --[EnergyAccountDescription]
			,EnergyDeliverySubTypeId --[EnergyDeliverySubTypeID] added on 4/9/2019 
			,'N' --[IsMultipleEnergySourceAccount]
			,TODAccount --[IsTimeOfDayAccount]
			,'N' --[HasAccountLevelChange]
			, CASE EnergyDeliveryType WHEN '5' THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END --- IsOECDefinedMeter --[HasMeters]
			,'N' --[HasMultipleActiveMeters]
			,SalesType --[SalesType]
			,DeliveryServiceClass --[DeliveryTariffRate]
			,DeliveryServiceClassEffectiveDate --[DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate]
			,DeliveryServiceClass --[CommodityTariffRate]
			,DeliveryServiceClassEffectiveDate --[CommodityTariffEffectiveDate]
			,BillingCycle --[BillingCycle]
			,'Y' --[Delivery]
			,'N' --[AccountInMultipleBuildings]
			,'N' --[SourceOfRevenue]
			,@BillingPeriod --[TurnOnDate]
			,'999912' --[TurnOffDate]
			,MunicipalCode --[MunicipalCode]
			,null --[Territory]
			,TensionCode --[Tension]
			,TripNumber --[TripNumber]
			,null --[PartSupplied]
			,AccountName --[UtilityServiceAccountName]
			,AccountAddress --[UtilityServiceAddress]
			,Borough --[Borough]
			,null --[Block]
			,null --[LotNumber]
			,NULL --[CityPlanningBIN]
			,null --[ELOAgencyAddress]
			,NULL --[LastPeriodOriginalBilled]
			,NULL --[LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled]
			,NULL --[LastZeroDollarsBillingPeriod]
			, CASE EnergyDeliveryType WHEN '5' THEN NULL ELSE 'N' END --[IsSeasonalAccount]
			,null --[AdjustmentRecordSeqid]
			,ContractNumber --- ContractNumber
			,'Y' --[FireAuditTrigger]
			,NULL --[Notes]
			,@AuthenticatedUserID --[AuthenticatedUserID]
			,GETDATE() --[DateAdded]
			,GETDATE() --[LastUpdate]
		FROM Common.ExchangeData
		WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;

		-- update UniqueAccount and isCurrentRecord since this is a freshly created record
		DECLARE @AccountSeqid seqid
		-- Get the Account sequence id after it is inserted
		SELECT @AccountSeqid  = ident_current('Billing.Account');

		UPDATE Billing.Account
		SET UniqueAccountSeqid = @AccountSeqid,
			IsCurrentRecord = 'Y',
			RecordVersion = 1 , -- since this is the first one
			FireAuditTrigger = 'N'
		WHERE AccountSeqid = @AccountSeqid;

		-- if we make it here and all is well, come back and update the record as processes
		UPDATE Common.ExchangeData
		SET IsProcessed = 'Y',
			AccountSeqid = @AccountSeqid
		WHERE ExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;

		SELECT @Message = '', @StatusCode = 1;
	END TRY
	BEGIN CATCH
		SET @Message = 'Error processing exchange  ' + CAST(@ExchangeSeqid AS VARCHAR(8))  + ' error message: ' + ERROR_MESSAGE()
		SET @StatusCode = 0
		;THROW 50000,@Message,1;
	END CATCH;
END;
